docs:
# Getting started with Google Hangouts Chat

**IMPORTANT:** _The above modules integrate with [Google Hangouts Chat](https://chat.google.com), Google's messaging platform for teams (G Suite users). They **DO NOT** work with [Google Hangouts](https://hangouts.google.com), which is a messaging platform available to all Google users._

To use any of these modules, you need to have a G Suite account with administrator rights, or ask your account administrator to help set up the connection between Google Hangouts Chat and Integromat. If you do not have a G Suite account yet, you can create one at [gsuite.google.com](https://gsuite.google.com/signup/basic/welcome). The Hangouts Chat API needs to be enabled in the Admin Console, as follows. First, click on the **Enable APIs and Services** link. 

![](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009183573/file.png)

In the Search bar, type **Hangouts Chat API** and click on the result.

![](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009183593/file.png)

On the next screen, click the **Enable** button. Integromat can now be connected as a Hangouts Chat bot.

![](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009138034/file.png)

## Integrating the Google Hangouts Chat service with Integromat

For 3rd party service integration with Hangouts Chat, Google uses the concept of chat bots. A chat bot acts like a regular participant in chat rooms or direct messages, even though, behind the scenes, it is implemented as a remote webservice or a Google Apps Script project. There are only two requirements for integrating your Integromat scenario with Hangouts Chat: first, you need to provide a URL to which Google will forward chat messages (and events such as "Added to Chat Room"), and second, the calculation of the response inside a scenario must take less that 30 seconds. For the first requirement, create a new Integromat scenario and insert a Google Hangouts Chat module called **Chat Listener**. Clicking on the module will let you create a new webhook (just give it a name and click **Save**), which will provide a dedicated URL that can be used to receive chat messages from Google.

![](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009183613/file.png)

Copy this URL by clicking the **Copy address to clipboard** button. Then, go to your G Suite Admin Console, select the **Hangouts Chat API** in the **Enabled APIs and services** section, and open its **Configuration** tab. Here you can give your Bot a name, choose if it will be available only in direct messages, chat rooms, or both, and finally, fill in its Bot URL from Integromat.

![](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009183633/file.png)

Now that Google knows where to send your messages, you can start building a response inside your Integromat scenario (just keep in mind that it needs to reach Google in less than 30 seconds). Sending a response is as simple as inserting a **Chat Response** module in the scenario's data flow. Below is an example scenario which uses filters to send a different response based on if the incoming message was a notification that your Bot was added to a chat room, or if it was an actual text message. 

![](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009138054/file.png)

The conversation with the Bot (in this case, named "integromatdev") will look similar to the following:

![](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009138074/file.png)

## Sending one-off messages to a Hangouts Chat Room

Integromat can also send one-off messages (not expecting a response) to any Hangouts Chat chat room that has a webhook URL associated with it. To create a chat room webhook in Hangouts Chat, click on the arrow next to the number of chat room participants to display the dropdown menu, and then select **Configure webhooks**.

![](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009138094/file.png)

In the pop-up window, click on **Add Webhook**, then give the webhook a name, and click **Save**. Copy the generated URL.

![](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009138114/file.png)

In Integromat, use the **Inject Message Into Room** module, which enables you to create a new connection, and use the chat room URL generated in the previous step as the destination.

![](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009183653/file.png)

After running the scenario, the message should appear in the Hangouts Chat chat room.

![](https://integromat.zendesk.com/hc/article_attachments/360009138134/file.png)
